@hackartisan I did not know there was a `--conservative` switch. Good to know!

orangelight.title: Fully enable lando and remove solr wrapper
Use custom Solr docker image and remove solr_wrapper

comments.body:
@hackartisan The line below the fix adds a MMS_ID to the URL for bound-with records and it would produce a URL like this: `/bibliographic/availability.json?bib_ids=444&deep=true,555` 

With this PR the URL will be `/bibliographic/availability.json?deep=true&bib_ids=444,555`
Ah, I see! I think a test would be good to protect against regression. It may be easy to test if it's extracted into a helper function?
Honestly I don't think it is worth spending the time refactoring the code to account for this, but if  you think we should I'll do it.
I understand. I won't block this PR.
I do think extracting it would also make it easier to read / understand.

> @hackartisan The line below the fix adds a MMS_ID to the URL for bound-with records and it would produce a URL like this: `/bibliographic/availability.json?bib_ids=444&deep=true,555`
> 
> With this PR the URL will be `/bibliographic/availability.json?deep=true&bib_ids=444,555`

@hectorcorrea can you give an example record where you've seen that this `/bibliographic/availability.json?bib_ids=444&deep=true,555` is happening (if there are more than one ids)? I haven't pulled this pr to test it locally.
OK. I will add a test to this so that we can all move on.
@hackartisan moved the logic to build the URL to its own method and added a test for it. Thanks for the push, this was indeed an improvement to the code.
Y'all rock.
~~@hectorcorrea thanks! Can you add @hackartisan in the last commit?~~ Sorry I misunderstood from your previous comment that you worked with @hackartisan on this. Disregard my comment.

Remove Request button if item is on reserve.

comments.body:
[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/41909112/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/41909112)

Coverage remained the same at 96.915% when pulling **b16c07c7c27c04f613ccc9039257c512b3f1d0e7 on reserves_request_button** into **425534cf73a76ab5b8569a0376f5725dce70f97a on main**.

Error:
```
"method":"GET","path":"/catalog/99123444323506421","format":"html","controller":"CatalogController","action":"show","status":500,"error":"ActionView::Template::Error: key not found \"title_display\"","duration":291.42,"view":0.0,"db":10.71,"ddsource":["ruby"],"@timestamp":"2021-08-04T01:07:56.468Z","@version":"1","message":"[500] GET /catalog/9912344432350642 (CatalogController#show)"
```

Line of code in orangelight: https://github.com/pulibrary/orangelight/blob/main/app/services/decorator_service.rb#L34

Line of code in bibdata: https://github.com/pulibrary/bibdata/blob/a13bc64520baab273aeef4f2d6ea6f411ec8fc98/marc_to_solr/lib/traject_config.rb#L161

I looked into the api call to make sure there is a 245 https://bibdata.princeton.edu/bibliographic/99123444323506421 

I will export the document from alma to test.

I tested and indexed locally the record with mms_id 99123444323506421 using the rake liberate:index_file with no errors and the record renders as expected in OL. I can't reproduce it the error locally.

Update: both staging and production have the title_display field. You can check this with 99123444323506421/raw at the end of the catalog url.
I also checked solr and the filed is there.
I reindexed the record in staging but nothing changed https://catalog-qa.princeton.edu/catalog/99123444323506421/. It still errors.

This is a screenshot of the record from my local environment: 

![Screen Shot 2021-08-04 at 12 56 10 PM](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9905193/128222679-8f52b485-e0fb-4f9a-b63d-6bf1c3eebf4b.png)
The culprit seems to be that the other version points to https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/99123923123506421 and this record does not have a `title_display`

orangelight.title: Prevents exception if a linked record does not have a title_display

comments.body:
@hectorcorrea thanks! I'm happy it crashed in your local and you could figure this out. I'm ok with the 'Unknown'. 
@kevinreiss @mzelesky does it sound ok to name a version unknown when there is no title or is there an other preferred text?

orangelight.title: Remove umlaut_base: https://getit.princeton.edu from the requests.yml
Online Links Display Full URL as title text

comments.body: @kevinreiss so what should the link title be?
I'm looking into it.

This record specifically has in alma an inactive electronic portfolio. This inactive url does not resolve to anything and it doesn't have a title because it is inactive. It should not be indexed in the electronic portfolio. One option would be not to include inactive portfolios in the publishing job (I don't know if this can be configured in alma. @mzelesky ) and the second option which we should implement asap is not to index electronic portfolio if 951 subfield $a has an 'inactive status'. I will open an issue for this in bibdata. Unfortunately there are a lot of records like this one with inactive portfolios and a lot of not so nice urls in the search results. 
another example:
record https://catalog.princeton.edu/catalog/99123430173506421 has an inactive electronic portfolio in alma.

orangelight.title: Remove mailcatcher from alma prod boxes

comments.body:
Done. Process taken:

```
ansible orangelight_alma_prod -a "service mailcatcher stop" -u pulsys --become
ansible orangelight_alma_prod -a "rm /lib/systemd/system/mailcatcher.service" -u pulsys --become
ansible orangelight_alma_prod -a "systemctl daemon-reload" -u pulsys --become
ansible orangelight_alma_prod -a "gem uninstall mailcatcher" -u pulsys --become
```
